storyInfo: The Military Commission formally seizes Londinium, stirring the nations of Terra awake. The Ursus Royal Guard makes its own presence known in Victoria. Driven away by Sarkaz mercenaries, Hoederer and companions resolve to locate the Lich's Messenger, and get some information.

attributes.text: The Senior Professor of Classics to the Victorian National University, Samuel Seuss, once likened the ample library of Sir Cassegrain to the holly trees upon Londinium's fringes.
\nIn these essences of knowledge, these long shadows of history, we never fail to find parallels to how we ourselves have gone, and to how we will go.

\nRecorded are the epics and philosophies, one by one filed away are mythologies and theories. Humble scholars fill page to page with their wisdom and diligence, each laureate poet a bookshelf to themselves.
\n'Someday the storm will pass, for hope can never truly die. What is formed of these accounts in ink; that is our civilization in all its pride.'

Sir Cassegrain was a decent gaolmate; we debated over many a question through our wall. The wall that was, perhaps, the sole reason our time came to an end without his realizing I was a Sarkaz; he simply took me as Victorian, one too mired in introspection at that.
\nI still remember his last words to me, before being dragged from that neighboring cell.
'In any time of trouble, a proud Victorian need only return there, and the winter of our discontent will once again feel not so endless after all, and the coming of spring the closest thing.'
\n'...Friend, you need only return there.'

attributes.content: You're SOL.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: I tried those already. Even the paper's the good calfskin stuff—those books ain't burning.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Why call it paper if it's calfskin, anyway? Why don't we say 'writing skin' or something?
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: I dunno.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Screw us, this fire just ain't happening. We've got all smoke and no warm soup pot.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: 'Soup'... This stuff's just water with a couple stems and scraps we tossed in.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: You know what, this is all their fault!
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Those sneering Royal Court shitheads have us out here doing all the hard and dirty work, snatching Londiniers across to work their factories across the ENTIRE city, and they won't even give us a hot bowl of something for the trouble.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Captain said we've officially seized Londinium now.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Defense Forces got disbanded. That Lettou guy's out, the Liberi.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Well, I'm starting to regret not going with W. Goddamn loony woman.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Whatever... probably wouldn't turn out any better if I did.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: What... are all these books, anyway?
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Could be discount catalogs for all I care.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Why would some old Feline collect this many discount catalogs?
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: What is it with you and questions. Who gives a shit what goes on in a Victorian's head.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Still, never seen an old man cry his eyes out like that. Were you watching? Got his embroidered lapel all gunked up with his own snot.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Hey, snap out of it! Get me some more books, the fire's about to go out.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: What are you doing?
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Uh... reading them.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: What 'reading'? You ain't literate! And all this shit's in Victorian anyway!
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Well, there's pictures in here too! Look at these drawings, there's a Feline girl here giving this boy a real slap. What do you think's the deal with these two?
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Cheating, I'd figure. Anything more interesting?
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: No, all the other pictures are dull... Just one of these things is a couple hundred pages. How many books do we have here?
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: And the thinner ones over there. They only put a few words on each line, so you have to keep looking down for the next one... What IS it Victorians are writing in these?
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Do the lands really have that much worth writing books about?
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: This one, this one, and that one... all kept in these beautiful glass cases, and they're all different kinds?
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Here's another possibility: Victorians are so stinking rich, they'll pay to bind their own toilet paper.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Hah. Maybe.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Why don't we have books of our own? They flip through these things so much the edges are curled...
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Maybe we do. Y'know you hear how the Liches are a bunch of nutjobs who hole themselves up in libraries. No one sees 'em for years and years, that's how long.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Not that my ass cares. Hot soup to drink means more than any of that.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Yeah. The days just blend together. These books just blend together.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Even if I can't read, I know it. There's never one new thing under the sun.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: A thousand years ago, we macheted people to death. Now, we've got more efficient weapons.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: A thousand years in the future, we'll be flying through the sky, and using... I dunno, clouds and stars? To keep on killing and killing.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: Y'know, if we put houses on the moons, plant our own food, maybe we won't have to keep fighting like this in the future? Maybe something even bigger'll happen, and everyone'll stop wanting to be up in arms?
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: Haha.
attributes.name: Starving Mercenary

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.content: *yawn* Never mind, let's get that next book burning.
attributes.name: Beleaguered Mercenary

attributes.text: Sometimes I wonder if the work I'm doing is just me satisfying myself, just trying to prove to myself I'm still one of the 'awake'.
\nWhat Ines said, really. It keeps me up at night and nothing else.
After all, Kazdel's not going to be overflowing with people who can use a printing press.

attributes.content: You need to get up to speed ASAP, boy. This isn't the classroom. I'm not obligated to teach you the ropes.
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: You could just run your butt back to the countryside. How many more months is your internship?
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: I—I'm very sorry, sir, I just... wanted to be scrupulous about my writing.
attributes.name: Red Wine Intern Journalist

attributes.content: 'Scrupulous'? I don't want a goddamn Catastrophology thesis, I want OUR circulation beating our union friends at Kawalerielki Sports, and I want them beaten hard, 24/7!
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: If you're the office workers passing by the newsstand, or the intercity net news subscribers, is an essay titled 'Victoria Makes Massive Strides in Catastrophology' going to pry your cash loose?
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: But—don't you think 'Sarkaz Destroy Victoria!' is a little... you know, for a headline...
attributes.name: Red Wine Intern Journalist

attributes.content: You think our readers want the truth? Even the Central Journal's top-tier subscribers aren't asking for the 'truth'.
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: You need to spoonfeed them worry, fear, feelings of superiority, sliiiightly leading emotional appeals followed by hard verdicts, and THEN they'll want more.
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: THEN they'll pluck cash out of their pockets. THEN you'll guarantee your goddamn job.
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: Who is it? You know what time it is right n—
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: ...How long ago did that—new courier truck leave with our plates?
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: Half an hour ago—is—is there some kind of breaking news from Victoria?
attributes.name: Red Wine Intern Journalist

attributes.content: No, you idiot! Move, we're going to the printers now! They should still be on shift! We can still make it!
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: I'll give the chief editor a call! You write me a new lead article ASAP! Front page material!
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: On what?
attributes.name: Red Wine Intern Journalist

attributes.content: My informant says Viviana—The Candle Knight, Nova Knightclub, long AWOL—she's formally announcing retirement TOMORROW!
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: Quick, we need to be the FIRST body in ALL OF KAZIMIERZ to report on this!
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: Oughta prove to the GCC just which Rose Paper editorial really matters most.
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: Then what about Victoria and The Shard...
attributes.name: Red Wine Intern Journalist

attributes.content: Who cares, boy! A million things a day happen on Terra—
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: And we only need the most meaningful scoops out of them all, remember that.
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: Call a cab already!
attributes.name: Red Wine Senior Editor

attributes.content: O—Okay!
attributes.name: Red Wine Intern Journalist

attributes.content: Come to mention, sir, there'd always been unlicensed devils around here running their own taxis...
attributes.name: Red Wine Intern Journalist

attributes.content: Have you noticed them kind of vanish lately?
attributes.name: Red Wine Intern Journalist

attributes.text: The history of Sarkaz is the history of war itself. It is a lamentable fact, one I am loyal to.
\nYet still I attempt to prove to them that slaughter aside, there are events about us worth being remembered, reflected on.
\nUpon this land, those events that had the luck to be written of assiduously—those can be counted on one's fingers.
\nAnd yet, even if I record these past affairs...

attributes.content: This isn't what we agreed on!
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: No stock means no stock, Tona. What you see is what you get. All Originium explosives are sold out.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: And the weapons I ordered? Are you expecting us to walk into that cave teeming with Originium slugs and giant gloompincers and Heaven knows what other monsters, and just—tackle them with our bare hands?
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: That's your problem to deal with, not mine. Listen here, you've been cruising the entire black market for the last three weeks and managed to get, what? Half a dozen weapons? Less.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: What mercenary squad could possibly snatch everything up? Are they insane? Even Solar Valley Industries couldn't possibly buy this much—
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: ...Was it a lord ameer?
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: So which sadsack lord ameer got ripped off this time? I want a hint. We'll divert around.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: N—No, no lord ameer. They were such a mystery, I couldn't say...
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: (Whisper) It was probably... the pasha. And—not just one.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: It might even be—
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: What the hell are you feeding me? Pashas on a shopping spree at the black market? And more than one?
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: That's impossible. They have their own channels, and... multiple, buying weapons in huge bulk? Do you know what that even entails?
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: All I've got is a blind guess.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: They went through several layers of middlemen, and used some foreign firms to keep their hands extra clean. Every purchase happened to be some quantity that wouldn't raise suspicion, so if someone called coincidence, it might just pass.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: But who, in Sargon, could ever monopolize all this so perfectly?
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: Hey, buddy.
Got my rides and supplies sorted?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Ayup. Four cars, rations, water, tents, all good to go.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: Good. Here's the cash.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: When the hell did 'Spacer' get that wealthy?
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: No, I hear he and his band of mercs are planning to ditch Sargon. They rustled up all the money they have to head someplace else.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: Columbia, probably, or Victoria? Lot more devil mercs career changing than usual, I feel like.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: What for? Don't all of 'Spacer's' relatives live in Sargon? Does he not care about his old baba with the broken leg?
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Who knows. I've never been able to make heads or tails of how these devils think. Maybe they're just sick enough of desert and rainforest, they want to switch up their surroundings now.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: ...That'd be best-case.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: It's been like this recently... things just getting weird levels of complicated, left and right. Makes no sense to me at all.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: —Dammit, the only thing my grandpa ever had to figure out was which leporibeast shorthorn ran the slowest and made the best dinner for us. They didn't hit this many setbacks in their time, did they?
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Could be us rural Sargon people just feel 'it' coming.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.content: 'It'?
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Just like a shorthorn, once it gets intense, it'll knock you flat.
attributes.name: Black Market Merchant

attributes.text: Even if I write of these, write of our dialects, and our recipes...
\nOf peasant wives' songs, of a chief courier's great drunken boasts; of romance in the trenches, of graffiti in the ruins...
These things, in the face of our suffering, pale beyond mention.
\nThey are reduced even to an irony of sorts, seeming to inform my readers (if I even have any) that we'd be best served using violence to wrest them back.
That was never my intent. Even so, I... have no right to be serving you my verdict.

attributes.content: That Messenger should be here by now. Did some fanciful girl steal his heart on the way again?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: I've had enough of his tardy excuses by now. Isn't there anyone who can drill into his head how much his job matters?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: He won't be coming. Postal Messenger Arthur Morrison is dead.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Dead?!
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Executed on grounds of treason.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: T—Treason? Wh... Who in the land are you?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: I'm doing my job—cooperate, and you'll make both our lives a lot easier. Tell me what you know about Arthur Morrison, please.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: I—I hardly knew him, really, just that he was the only postal Messenger around who'd make the run to Londinium—my own daughter goes to university there—so him and I only exchanged the odd word.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: He was a treasonist...? Was he taking Sarkaz help? My girl wrote to me how Londinium's been littered with them lately.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: That wretch! I knew he was a scoundrel at the first moment! Trust him to gang up with the devils—he got what he deserved!
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Our comprehension is that Arthur Morrison served Ursus.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Ursus? B-But...
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: And you... were his coworker, Mr. Wesley Roett.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Wha—
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Hah, hahah—sir, surely you must be joking! I'm a Feline born and bred—I've been planting potatoes here all my life—I couldn't speak you a word of Ursine!
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: There must be some misunderstanding here!
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: I know potatoes couldn't afford your daughter's tuition at the Victorian National University.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Eaaagh!
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: If you insist on being stubborn, I can free you of your other arm too.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Don't waste my time. No resistance of yours is meaningful.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: ...So, the rumors were true.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: That Ursus was right! Londinium's been occupied! For the past month, I haven't gotten a single word from the place, not even the tiniest hearsay.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Those goddamned Sarkaz. They disgrace us, they murder us, they enslave us! And you, you self-professed protectors of Victoria, what have you done?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Don't you have anyone in Londinium? A dear friend, a father, a mother, a child?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Of course, of course, you're bigger than that! You get to pull them out safe, yes you do.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: But us peasant class, no, we thought we could sent our children to great old Londinium, to the heart of Victoria, where surely they'd grow beyond our wildest expectations.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: And now? Haha, hahah! They're laborers to the Sarkaz, slaves to them, in our own country's capital!
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Those devils are turning Victoria's tempest on Victoria itself, and you people are just letting it happen!
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: You could never hope to grasp Victoria's motives with your shallow insight.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: All you need to do is take me to your intel exchange.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: As if I woul—!
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Excuse me?
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Ghk—rgggh—
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Eugh...
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: An ashen lance bursts forth from his body.
The man facing him thrusts his hands out, an attempt to allay the fear of his chest being run through.
His hands, the instant they touch that deep impurity, are warped and withered.

attributes.text: *hiss*...

attributes.content: From afar comes a wracked breath, spine-chilling.
It's me. 'Castshire's flowers bloom for spring.'
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Close all comms. If I haven't initiated contact again in fifteen minutes, abandon this town immediately.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: ...May I have the strength not to drown in the flowers' scent.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: In the height of midsummer, he exhales frigid mist.
He cannot cower. He cannot shrink. He must establish communications with the opposite side, in Victoria's name.
Where is it?

attributes.text: *hiss*... *huff*...
11, 29, 1. (Code word).

attributes.content: He must not look back. They must not catch sight of each other. He only hopes his adversary is fully aware to abide by the rules of this little game.
He can tether a beast, but not a Poltergeist.
Snowflakes whirls about, jet black sinking into the soil of Victoria.
A long, slender shadow stretches out from underfoot. He knows. It's right behind him.
How close? His heart pounds like thunder. Black breaths clamor at his back. All around him, dead silence.

attributes.text: *hiss*...

attributes.content: (Gaulish) I need an explanation.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: 93. (Code word).
(Gaulish) This operation has not received Royal assent. We will not pardon any breach of authority.
(Gaulish) The treasonists have all been executed. Over.
(Gaulish) Understood. We've never met before.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: *huff*...
...He's gone.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Sir Trilby Asher, our surveillance picked up—
attributes.name: Undercover Secret Agent

attributes.content: Your surveillance picked up nothing.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: The fact he could enter and leave us alive, that declares where Victoria and Ursus stand. All this needs to be reported directly to the Duke.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Wesley Roett was cornered and took his own life. The mission is over.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: Seems to me like the Armies and the Emperor aren't on the same page.
attributes.name: Undercover Secret Agent

attributes.content: But any action we take could succeed in bringing about their conciliation.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.content: They haven't settled on their plans yet, but their Empire... their fear, that will make their decision for them.
attributes.name: Behatted Person

attributes.text: Tell me—has my work fallen among the firewood too? Are all Sarkaz's lives, save for being lit aflame, devoid of any meaning?
\nThen why do I still insist on recording? Why do I still insist on writing?
\nBecause while my history of war recounts our destruction time and time again...
It is my wish to leave the song of every soldier, after the fighting is over, as they turn their gazes to yonder Kazdel.

attributes.content: To our seven. Three cars, fifteen-plus riders. They've been following us forever, but... they're staying wary.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Following, this entire time. Just following.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Why not tell W to hang a U-turn? Maybe they'll be happy to say hi. You could get some free Londinium souvenirs.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Souvenirs? Inside that giant ball of Arts they're hand-shaping?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I'm treasuring the last few close shaves just fine, thanks.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The way these mercs are working doesn't add up. Especially the way they're hunting us. No, not hunting... they're driving us off.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: They want us away from Londinium.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Aww, our high-'n'-mighty General Manfred's sparing your life, isn't that sweet of him. You sure you two didn't swear a blood oath?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Wanna take his kind advice, scoot back to Kazdel and teach some slum kiddos how to read?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: My point is, who let you out of the Military Commission's dungeon? You were going walkies outside of Londinium's walls by the time I picked you up.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: My cell was left unguarded for a while. I thought it was a trap at first, but now I think I'm in something worse.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Sure, he can be roundabout with me, hinting for me to go resolve some pain in the ass affair... but I think I'd prefer him just killing me, then. That would've been easier.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Not to mention, we still aren't sure what 'pain in the ass' we're even solving.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Then don't bother with it.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: W, can you speed up a little? It's time we said goodbye to this clingy convoy of send-offs.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Yeah, my second-hander here's not gonna stand up to much abuse. Good news, though—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: We just hit a minefield.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Laid half an hour earlier by yours personally.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Now, butts in seats.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: This looks to me like you're just fording Bomb River.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Haha! I left them the bigger share, I promise.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Stop the car once we circle that forest ahead. From there, we'll get off and proceed on foot. A vehicle's too large of a target, and they'd catch up sooner or later anyway.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Here's hoping you DO remember where you buried every mine, W.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Well, hooray for us. We're all in one piece.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: How's that? I did remember.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Well, a couple went off, but... uhh, you know, what was the term? 'Tectonic movement' did it.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: They haven't caught up. I think we've successfully thrown them off.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We need more information. Ideally, we rendezvous with Rhodes Island ASAP. Ascalon and the Doctor are on Windermere's warship right now.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: There's a few things I'm... very uneasy about.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What did you see?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's just intuition. The less I see any problem, the more uneasy I am.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You guys met this 'Doctor'. And now they're Rhodes Island's Doctor.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...I can't give you the full verdict yet, but there's no doubt that in a sense, the Doctor has 'weakened'.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: And I don't mean that in any negative way. But maybe it's not a 'weak Doctor' we need so much right now.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hmph. You sure? Who knows if some Rhodes op will remember some random thing that happened in Chernobog, and just like that, I get a knife planted in my back?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Are you really as skeptical as you'd like to tell us, W?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hard to say. There's an old hag kind of keeping me at arm's length from their beloved 'Doctor'.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: W.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You've spent plenty of time walking this battlefield. Any ideas?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Haha... I've just been prodded this way and that like some bug. Can't even organize a sensible military op, so all I do is sit in my front row seat and spectate the most magical city siege modern society has to offer...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...Ha. Hmph.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Chaos.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Sometimes I even have to wonder, at this point, is anyone actually conducting this battle?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The Royal Court's legions couldn't work together to save their lives. And who gives a shit about all the smallfry corps scuttling in from the four corners to try and live their dreams of Victorian vengeance?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But the ultimate mastermind here is Theresis. So this chaos has to have been planned down to the last detail.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: He wasn't juggling some strategic lollapalooza. He just... set the stage.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: —And now he's waiting.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: As for what he's waiting for... I don't want to guess.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We can't just go braindumb and reach out to the Doctor or Dr. Kal'tsit, hoping they'll give us the orders. We suffered enough with Babel.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We need to seize the initiative. There's a... source of info that might be more open to us than ever, in our current position.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What position? The pathetic little creepy-crawlies?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Essentially. Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Right, and just on the off-chance—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Have either of you heard of... any method to kill a Lich?
attributes.name: Hoederer
